title: Skeleton (monster)
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For the item left behind by rotting [corpses](/Corpse "Corpse"), see [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A skeleton compelled to unlife by the exercise of necromancy.***"God save us from the skeleton Who sitteth at the feast!" -James Jeffery Roche, \_The Skeleton at the Feast\_. 1890. |

**Skeletons** are the reanimated bones of once-living creatures. As a type of [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead"), their stats are based on what the monster had in life.

## Useful Info

Skeletons are slower, stupider, and clumsier than their alive counterparts. Skeletons are weaker versions of [zombies](/Zombie "Zombie").

- **HP:** (HD)d4 + 5\*HD
- **AC:** Original - 6
- **EV:** Original - 7
- **Speed:** Original - 2 (at least 3)
- **Attack flavour:** None
- **Special:** Does not regenerate, cannot traverse stairs

Skeletons may be created with the [Necrotise](/Necrotise "Necrotise") spell. They can also be found in a couple [vaults](/Vault "Vault"). A newly-animated skeleton will drop weapons and armour that they were wearing.

## Identifying Skeletons

Different monsters will leave behind skeletons with differing stats, but *Crawl* tends to lump them all together, making identifying them at a glance difficult. Console mode will display skeletons as either **z** or **Z**, depending on their size. Tiles mode provides different tiles for several different kinds of skeletons, but there are still many different monsters that fall under each type. In any case, if you want to find out exactly what you'll be fighting, simply hit **x** and highlight the skeleton in question.

Below are all the categories of skeletons in tiles mode:

[![Bat skeleton.png](/images/a/a0/Bat_skeleton.png)](/File:Bat_skeleton.png) [Bats](/Bat "Bat")

[![Skeleton bird.png](/images/f/ff/Skeleton_bird.png)](/File:Skeleton_bird.png) [Birds](/List_of_birds "List of birds")

[![Skeleton centaur.png](/images/3/37/Skeleton_centaur.png)](/File:Skeleton_centaur.png) [Centaurs](/List_of_centaurs "List of centaurs")

[![Skeleton draconian.png](/images/0/08/Skeleton_draconian.png)](/File:Skeleton_draconian.png) [Draconians](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians")

[![Skeleton dragon.png](/images/2/2d/Skeleton_dragon.png)](/File:Skeleton_dragon.png) [Dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons")

[![Skeleton drake.png](/images/d/de/Skeleton_drake.png)](/File:Skeleton_drake.png) [Drakes](/List_of_dragons#Drakes "List of dragons")

[![Skeleton fish.png](/images/d/d1/Skeleton_fish.png)](/File:Skeleton_fish.png) Fish

[![Skeleton frog.png](/images/8/84/Skeleton_frog.png)](/File:Skeleton_frog.png) [Frogs](/List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians#Amphibian_Types "List of reptiles and amphibians")

[![Skeleton small humanoid.png](/images/6/6e/Skeleton_small_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_small_humanoid.png) Humanoids (small)

[![Skeleton medium humanoid.png](/images/6/69/Skeleton_medium_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_medium_humanoid.png) Humanoids (medium)

[![Skeleton large humanoid.png](/images/2/2b/Skeleton_large_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_large_humanoid.png) Humanoids (large)

[![Skeleton hydra 1.png](/images/e/e2/Skeleton_hydra_1.png)](/File:Skeleton_hydra_1.png) [![Skeleton hydra 2.png](/images/9/9d/Skeleton_hydra_2.png)](/File:Skeleton_hydra_2.png) [![Skeleton hydra 3.png](/images/0/0e/Skeleton_hydra_3.png)](/File:Skeleton_hydra_3.png) [![Skeleton hydra 4.png](/images/a/ad/Skeleton_hydra_4.png)](/File:Skeleton_hydra_4.png) [![Skeleton hydra 5.png](/images/a/a9/Skeleton_hydra_5.png)](/File:Skeleton_hydra_5.png) [Hydras](/Hydra "Hydra")

[![Skeleton lernaean 1.png](/images/f/fc/Skeleton_lernaean_1.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_1.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 2.png](/images/c/c7/Skeleton_lernaean_2.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_2.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 3.png](/images/5/57/Skeleton_lernaean_3.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_3.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 4.png](/images/0/00/Skeleton_lernaean_4.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_4.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 5.png](/images/e/e3/Skeleton_lernaean_5.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_5.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 6.png](/images/d/d5/Skeleton_lernaean_6.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_6.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 7.png](/images/e/eb/Skeleton_lernaean_7.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_7.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 8.png](/images/a/a0/Skeleton_lernaean_8.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_8.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 9.png](/images/a/a5/Skeleton_lernaean_9.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_9.png) [![Skeleton lernaean 10.png](/images/7/72/Skeleton_lernaean_10.png)](/File:Skeleton_lernaean_10.png) [The Lernaean hydra](/The_Lernaean_hydra "The Lernaean hydra")

[![Skeleton lizard.png](/images/8/87/Skeleton_lizard.png)](/File:Skeleton_lizard.png) [Lizards](/List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians#Lizard_types "List of reptiles and amphibians")

[![Skeleton naga.png](/images/a/a2/Skeleton_naga.png)](/File:Skeleton_naga.png) [Nagas](/List_of_nagas "List of nagas")

[![Skeleton small quadruped.png](/images/9/98/Skeleton_small_quadruped.png)](/File:Skeleton_small_quadruped.png) Quadrupeds (small)

[![Skeleton large quadruped.png](/images/f/f7/Skeleton_large_quadruped.png)](/File:Skeleton_large_quadruped.png) Quadrupeds (large)

[![Skeleton winged quadruped.png](/images/6/66/Skeleton_winged_quadruped.png)](/File:Skeleton_winged_quadruped.png) Quadrupeds (winged)

[![Skeleton snake.png](/images/9/9a/Skeleton_snake.png)](/File:Skeleton_snake.png) [Snakes](/List_of_snakes "List of snakes")

[![Skeleton troll.png](/images/e/e1/Skeleton_troll.png)](/File:Skeleton_troll.png) [Trolls](/List_of_trolls "List of trolls")

[![Skeleton turtle.png](/images/2/20/Skeleton_turtle.png)](/File:Skeleton_turtle.png) [Turtles](/List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians#Turtle_Types "List of reptiles and amphibians")

[![Skeleton ugly thing.png](/images/2/2d/Skeleton_ugly_thing.png)](/File:Skeleton_ugly_thing.png) [Ugly things](/Ugly_thing "Ugly thing")

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), skeletons on the ground could be re-animated using [Animate Skeleton](/Animate_Skeleton "Animate Skeleton") or [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead"). Reanimated monsters kept their weapons and armour. Skeletons were also removed from the main [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon")'s spawn table.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), skeletons were more important. You could butcher a corpse to [eat](/Food "Food") its [chunks](/Chunk "Chunk"), then animate it into a skeleton. You could not do this with [zombies](/Zombie "Zombie").
- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton item, though Animate Skeleton always left chunks.
html:
Skeleton (monster)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For the item left behind by rotting corpses, see skeleton.

A skeleton compelled to unlife by the exercise of necromancy.

"God save us from the skeleton
Who sitteth at the feast!"
-James Jeffery Roche, _The Skeleton at the Feast_. 1890.

Skeletons are the reanimated bones of once-living creatures. As a type of derived undead, their stats are based on what the monster had in life.

Useful Info

Skeletons are slower, stupider, and clumsier than their alive counterparts. Skeletons are weaker versions of zombies.

  • HP: (HD)d4 + 5*HD
  • AC: Original - 6
  • EV: Original - 7
  • Speed: Original - 2 (at least 3)
  • Attack flavour: None
  • Special: Does not regenerate, cannot traverse stairs

Skeletons may be created with the Necrotise spell. They can also be found in a couple vaults. A newly-animated skeleton will drop weapons and armour that they were wearing.

Identifying Skeletons

Different monsters will leave behind skeletons with differing stats, but Crawl tends to lump them all together, making identifying them at a glance difficult. Console mode will display skeletons as either z or Z, depending on their size. Tiles mode provides different tiles for several different kinds of skeletons, but there are still many different monsters that fall under each type. In any case, if you want to find out exactly what you'll be fighting, simply hit x and highlight the skeleton in question.

Below are all the categories of skeletons in tiles mode:

Bats

Birds

Centaurs

Draconians

Dragons

Drakes

Fish

Frogs

Humanoids (small)

Humanoids (medium)

Humanoids (large)

Hydras

The Lernaean hydra

Lizards

Nagas

Quadrupeds (small)

Quadrupeds (large)

Quadrupeds (winged)

Snakes

Trolls

Turtles

Ugly things

History

  • Prior to 0.29, skeletons on the ground could be re-animated using Animate Skeleton or Animate Dead. Reanimated monsters kept their weapons and armour. Skeletons were also removed from the main Dungeon's spawn table.
  • Prior to 0.26, skeletons were more important. You could butcher a corpse to eat its chunks, then animate it into a skeleton. You could not do this with zombies.
  • Prior to 0.23, butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton item, though Animate Skeleton always left chunks.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Skeleton_(monster)&oldid=76003"

They can also be found in a couple [[vault]]s. Reanimated monsters kept their weapons and armour. Skeletons were also removed from the main [[Dungeon]]'s spawn table. *Prior to [[0.26]], skeletons were more important. You could butcher a corpse to [[food|eat]] its [[chunk]]s, then animate it into a skeleton. You could not do this with [[zombie]]s. *Prior to [[0.23]], butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton item, though Animate Skeleton always left chunks.
